questions.question_text: What is the maximum number of actions you can have per Workflow Rule?

discussion.content:
You can’t import these records via the Data Import Wizard:
Assets
Cases
Campaigns
Contracts
Documents
Opportunities
Products
This is one of the reason I dislike Salesforce - lack of consistency. What's wrong to enable this tool for other standard objects? Stupid!

Selected Answer: B
Opportunities are not supported by Data Import Wizard

Salesforce provides an in-built Data Import wizard that is accessible through the Setup menu and can help you to import: 
 Accounts
 Contacts.
 Leads
 Campaign members
 Person accounts
 Custom objects

Opportunities is NOT included in the list of Standard Objects which can be imported using Import Wizard, according to this link:
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=import_with_data_import_wizard.htm&type=5
The Data Import Wizard makes it easy to import data for many standard Salesforce objects, including accounts, contacts, leads, solutions, campaign members, and person accounts.
False..Import Wizard only used to import Accounts,contacts,Leads,solutions..
Only several standard objects can be imported via Import Wizard

Strictly speaking, it is true, as you can use Essentials Edition (if you have it), to import Opportunities.
The general answer to this is False, however.
Why can't I use the data import wizard to import object records?

questions.question_text: In order to import Opportunity records into Salesforce, a system administrator may use the Import Wizard.

questions.question_text: The maximum number of values in controlling picklists is the same as in dependent picklists.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
No, the maximum number of values in controlling picklists and dependent picklists in Salesforce is not the same. The maximum number of values allowed in a controlling picklist is 1,000, while the maximum number of values allowed in a dependent picklist is 300. It's important to keep these limits in mind when designing your picklist fields and their dependencies to ensure they meet your data requirements.
